reviews.text: Little expensive imo. Clean enough and staff friendly and helpful. Easy to get into.

It's a standard 2 platform station with 2 ticket machines and a ticket office. There is at least one vending machine, it allows card payments. There is a departure screen on each platform. 
  There are improvement prospects for the interchange if the area nearby is redeveloped.
  There are potential train service improvements from Goole an obvious one is an hourly service to Hensall. One route is to Knottingley and the other is a new one to Temple Hirst, Brayton, and Selby. The trains would run on alternate hours to each route.

A grim place to arrive at. Much better to depart from as wherever you're going to will be better. The vending machines are smashed to bits. The waiting areas are freezing cold and wet when the ticket office is shut. It looks like something from the war years.

The ticket / information office needs to be open later or reopen for the evening peak. There are enough trains for Goole 's needs with two exceptions, an hourly service to Wakefield via Knottingley and a longer term service to Selby via Snaith, and Brayton.
